Legal_Issue: Whether the Citizenship Judge reasonably denied citizenship due to insufficient residency evidence
Application_Facts: Applicant lacked documentation for 106 days and had credibility issues
Court_Ruling: The Citizenship Judge's decision was reasonable
Grounds_for_Claim: Insufficient proof of physical presence in Canada
Legal_Standard: Applicant must prove 1,095 days of physical presence
Procedural_Issue: Judicial review under s 14(5) of the Citizenship Act
Credibility_Assessment: Credibility concerns noted by the Citizenship Judge
Legal_Provision_Cited: s 5(1)(c), s 14(5) of the Citizenship Act
Governing_Rule: Applicant must prove 1,095 days of physical presence in Canada
Cause_Description: Applicant failed to meet residency requirement due to missing evidence and credibility concerns
Evidence_Handling: Insufficient evidence provided to establish residency
Legal_Provision: s 5(1)(c) and s 14(5) of the Citizenship Act
Evidence_Assessment: Evidence found inadequate to prove required physical presence
Decision_Rationale: Decision was reasonable based on lack of evidence and credibility issues
